page.title: 07SIR THOMAS TRESHAM
page.content:
Sir Thomas Tresham (1545-1605) was an original and talented man. The 'New Bield',as it was sometimes called, was not his only building, but it is in many ways his most interesting one. He was a very religious Roman Catholic at the time of the Elizabethan persecution, and all his creations were to do with religion.The theme of the New Bield was the passion and death of our lord.His son was involved in the Gunpowder plot and died in the Tower of London.His second son died shortly after his own death in 1605.
There is a college in Corby and Kettering named Tresham College.
